alert.note: Alert for Middle Rio Grande Valley, Albuquerque Metro Area; Sandia, Manzano Mountains Including Edgewood (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 7:14PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORM OUTFLOW WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN SANDOVAL AND BERNALILLO COUNTIES THROUGH 745 PM MDT... At 710 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm outflow over eastern Albuquerque, moving north at 25 mph. Reduced visibility in blowing dust has been observed in the South Valley and near the Sunport. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph with blowing dust. SOURCE...Public. IMPACT...Reduced visibility in blowing dust. Locations impacted include... Albuquerque, Rio Rancho, Corrales, Bernalillo, Los Ranchos De Albuquerque, Enchanted Hills, Cabezon, Coronado State Monument, Vista Hills and Sandia Pueblo. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 148 and 171. Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 218 and 246. Highway 550 between Mile Markers 1 and 9. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Blowing dust associated with strong thunderstorm winds can reduce visibilities below one quarter mile at times.

area.areaDesc: Middle Rio Grande Valley, Albuquerque Metro Area; Sandia, Manzano Mountains Including Edgewood
